page.title: 07SOCIAL CONCERN (cont.)
page.content: village. Part of a fine wood of poplar trees would have been felled and some allotments cleared, the outcome is being eagerly awaited. There are many young people in and around Wickham, but unfortunately for them, not very many places to go to. There is a meadow and a field were children can play and a river for fishing. Denise Miller has worked in Taylors for seven years and sympathises with the youngsters who just sit around on the Hill with nothing to do. "There isn't a youth club, sports facility, or even a coffee bar, a take away food shop would be useful." She was glad when she was old enough to be able to drive and go somewhere else for entertainment.
